intro: Oligosporus nuttallianus, commonly known as the Nuttall's oligosporus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features include a taproot system and a distinct umbellate inflorescence, which are common traits among members of its family. Oligosporus nuttallianus is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
